contentful_fields.subheading: Earn a STEM-designated MBA from the UC Davis Graduate School of Management (GSM) in 24–36 months.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum highlights
featured_products.introduction: This STEM-designated program will equip you with the business skills, tools, and competencies you need to lead positive change in a competitive global environment. Learn from the same faculty as on-campus MBA students as you expand or refine your professional interests.

Collaborate with peers on an integrated management project, where you’ll gain hands-on experience solving real-world problems.

title: Master of Arts in International Relations
primary_description: The Master of Arts in International Relations (MAIR) program prepares you to cultivate the economic, statistical, and critical thinking skills needed to analyze cross-cultural communications, foreign, and public policies.
secondary_description: American University's School of International Service offers two different Master degree programs online. Both programs are delivered through live classes, taught by world-renowned faculty, and include a visit to American University's campus in Washington, DC, to help students build the skills to effect positive international change. Depending on which degree students pursue, the programs can be completed in 12–24 months. A bachelor's degree is required; but GRE/GMAT scores are not.
tertiary_description: Global Security -- Uncover ways to prevent, mitigate, and manage conflicts globally as you investigate the dynamics of war, peace, and security.,International Development -- Discover how policies, politics, economics, sustainability, and healthcare impact development in communities and nations across the globe.,International Negotiation and Conflict Resolution - Examine the causes of international conflict, and apply strategic negotiation tactics that can help resolve global disputes.,United States Foreign Policy and National Security - Explore the historical, political, and economic underpinnings of strategic policy formulation and execution.

contentful_fields.subheading: Influence decisions across borders with the online Master of Arts in International Relations (MAIR) from American University’s School of International Service (SIS).

featured_products.heading: Concentrations
featured_products.introduction:
The Master of Arts in International Relations (MAIR) program prepares you to cultivate the economic, statistical, and critical thinking skills needed to analyze cross-cultural communications and foreign policy.

You can choose from a range of international affairs concentrations:

product_list.description: Uncover ways to prevent, mitigate, and manage conflicts globally as you investigate the dynamics of war, peace, and security.
Discover how politics, economics, sustainability, and healthcare impact development in communities and nations across the globe.
Examine the causes of international conflict, and apply strategic negotiation tactics that can help resolve global disputes.

subject: Business & Management

contentful_fields.page_title: Syracuse University Executive Master of Public Administration (EMPA) online
contentful_fields.subheading: The online Executive MPA, delivered by the Maxwell School of Citizenship and Public Affairs, prepares learners — who have extensive professional leadership experience —  to solve public service challenges from the highest levels of their organizations.

featured_products.heading: Core courses
featured_products.introduction:
The Maxwell School designed the online EMPA for professionals who have demonstrated leadership experience and excellence. Online EMPA learners begin to formulate, implement, and evaluate the policies that drive powerful change in their communities. 

Explore the nuances of organizational leadership and management, and connect with expert instructors who will teach you how to use evidence-based analysis to make a positive impact in your community. 

Core courses include:

product_list.description: Study a combination of basic economic principles and policy analysis techniques. Use cost-benefit analysis as a way to discover the rationale for and limits to public sector policies.
Develop a foundational understanding of leadership theories and apply them to managerial situations to improve leadership skills and competencies within your organization.

Integrate learned concepts — from across the online EMPA curriculum — to design an evidence-based master’s project paper that has practical application to a real-world organization. This capstone is generally taken at the end of the program.

title: Master of Data Analytics (Online)
primary_description: Study data analytics online at a leading university
secondary_description:
The University of Sydney’s Master of Data Analytics (Online) prepares you to become a well-rounded data professional equipped with the skills to collect, assess and translate the data important to you and your organisation.

With the guidance of expert academics, you will learn how to translate raw data into actionable insights that drive better business.

contentful_fields.page_title: University of Sydney Master of Data Analytics (Online)
contentful_fields.subheading: The Master of Data Analytics course from the top-ranked University of Sydney turns the data-curious into versatile data professionals, arming you with the expertise to not only gather and evaluate data but also effectively communicate its insights to key stakeholders.

featured_products.heading: Learn to turn data insights into creative solutions
featured_products.introduction: The Master of Data Analytics offers online classes instructed by a diverse group of academic experts, providing you with the skills to gather and implement valuable data insights in various organizational contexts. The course covers a wide array of data applications and subjects, including core courses and electives like the ethical aspects of data acquisition, managing intricate data structures, and data governance.

product_list.description: Modeling Complex Data Structures, Data Visualisation and Communication, Predictive, Analysis, Experimental Design and Analysis

title: Master of Science in Speech-Language Pathology
secondary_description: Prepare for a career as a speech-language pathologist with a robust, innovative curriculum that is rooted in Christian values, while studying either full time or part time.

contentful_fields.page_title: Pepperdine University Master of Science in Speech-Language Pathology online
contentful_fields.subheading: Prepare for a career as a speech-language pathologist with a robust, innovative curriculum that is rooted in Christian values, while studying either full time or part time.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The online Master of Science in Speech-Language Pathology curriculum progresses from fundamental knowledge to advanced practices and competencies, preparing you to care for patients of all ages across the entire care spectrum. Through engaging, online learning courses, three onsite experiences at the Pepperdine Calabasas Campus, and clinical field practicums, you’ll develop the skills to become a compassionate, expert speech-language pathologist ready to serve your community. All courses and clinical requirements are designed to meet American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA) and Council on Academic Accreditation (CAA) requirements.

product_list.description: Complete 22 online courses covering speech-language pathology, from prevention to treatment of communication and swallowing disorders in both pediatric and adult populations.

Connect with your Pepperdine University SLP peers and faculty mentor at orientation, gain hands-on experience through simulations, and participate in the graduation ceremony through three on-campus sessions.

Experience a comprehensive clinical practicum with 400+ supervised hours across five courses, including simulation-based training and placements in diverse settings for both pediatric and adult populations.
Depending upon prior course work, students may be required to complete all foundational courses before beginning the program.

contentful_fields.page_title: University of London online undergraduate programmes
contentful_fields.subheading: Undergraduate programmes in economics, management, finance, and the social sciences designed for professionals who want to make a difference in their fields.

featured_products.heading: Nine online degrees — one prestigious community
featured_products.introduction: The University of London offers nine online undergraduate degrees in disciplines like economics, data science, business and management, finance and accounting, and international relations. Each online programme is designed and led by academics with years of industry experience, and each programme offers its learners the practical skills they need to accomplish their unique career goals.

Interested in the processes, procedures, and practices needed to manage some of the world's leading organizations? The online BSc Business and Management programme will provide you with the strategic thinking and decision-making skills you need to succeed.

title: Master of Health Administration
secondary_description: Bachelor's holders with at least two years of experience in the healthcare sector can earn their Master from GW's CAHME-accredited online Master of Health Administration program. With no GRE scores required to apply, you can become an effective leader in health care systems in as few as 24 months with a degree from Milken Institute School of Public Health.
subject: Health & Safety

contentful_fields.page_title: George Washington University Master of Health Administration (MHA) online
contentful_fields.subheading: Stand at the forefront of healthcare as a Milken Institute School of Public Health graduate, and improve the way we implement state-of-the-art healthcare delivery.

featured_products.heading: The MHA@GW curriculum
featured_products.introduction:
The multidisciplinary curriculum concentrates on core principles of healthcare management, health economics, financial leadership, and policy. MHA@GW focuses on enhancing the skill sets necessary for successful health organization leadership, including:

Leadership and ethics,
Management and strategy, 
Information technology and decisions science,
Community health and quantitative methods, 
Finances and economics,
Quality improvement, and 
Law and regulation. 

The program includes eight 10-week learning modules. Below are two such modules:

product_list.header: Module Three — Health Care Financial Management
product_list.description: This module provides an understanding of the financial operations of health care organizations including financial reporting, cost management, sources of revenue and budgeting in health care organizations. It will focus on the theory and application of health care finance as it applies to health care organizations. The module includes specific emphasis on CFO responsibilities, revenue cycle, coding, reimbursement mechanisms, managed care contracting, personnel expenses, supply chain and materials management.

product_list.header: Module Six — Quality and Performance Improvement
product_list.description: Effective health care leaders understand that quality improvement tools and methods must be at the heart of every health care organization. Whether it is the quality of clinical care and patient safety, driving out waste and excessive cost or striving to deliver the most cost-effective care possible, quality improvement must be part of the skill set of every health care leader. From the principles of W. Edwards Deming’s statistical process control to the six sigma and Toyota-style production models, quality improvement is and will continue to be the yardstick by which outstanding health care organizations are measured.

title: Artificial Intelligence Certificate
secondary_description: Columbia Engineering, top ranked for engineering and artificial intelligence, is where visionaries come to confront the grand challenges of our time and design for the future. AI is transforming our world, and our online AI program enables business leaders across industries to be pioneers of this transformation.
subject: Engineering

contentful_fields.page_title: Columbia Engineering online Artificial Intelligence (AI) program
contentful_fields.subheading: Learn how to build artificial intelligence-powered systems, products, and services in this non-credit, non-degree executive education program.

featured_products.heading: Core courses
featured_products.introduction:
The AI executive education program is centered on building knowledge through the following: the provision and facilitation of insightful instruction, vigorous discussion, and meaningful peer collaboration. Learners have the opportunity to bolster their skill sets through a range of assessments, quizzes, exercises, and projects.    

The main curriculum consists of six core courses:

product_list.header: Intro to AI and Business for AI
product_list.description: Discover how AI and machine learning applications can transform customer service, sales, and marketing strategy across a range of industries.
Learn to design and analyze efficient algorithms, such as sorting and searching, dynamic programming, and regression and classification.
Explore the theoretical underpinnings and practical applications of neural networks and DL in solving challenges in your business context.
Examine the real-world applications of language modeling, such as text generation, machine translation, information extraction, and automatic summarization.
Learn how algorithms integrate with the physical world via mechanisms such as image sensing, processing and filtering, segmentation, and object recognition.
Investigate how data security and privacy relate to data mining and storage, and study the legal, social, and policy development frameworks that apply.

Syracuse University’s online M.S. in Computer Science program prepares students to spearhead groundbreaking innovation across industries. Complete in as few as 15 months with 4 cohort start dates per year. No GRE required to apply
subject: Computer Science

contentful_fields.subheading: Learn how to build or enhance the computer systems, algorithms, and softwares that fuel cutting-edge solutions.

featured_products.heading: Course spotlight: Machine learning
featured_products.introduction: This course examines the relationship between machine learning and computer security and outlines the basics of machine learning theory and its methodologies. In addition to evaluating complex research problems, students learn high-level topics, including:

product_list.description: Discover the algorithms that work as the backbone of machine learning capabilities.
Explore the functions of neural networks, a subset of machine learning that mimics the cognitive functions of the human brain.
Measure how well a machine can comprehend tasks using mathematical frameworks.
Learn how to protect essential assets and information from unauthorized criminal activity.

title: Post-Baccalaureate Certificate in Cybersecurity Penetration Testing
secondary_description: Gain a comprehensive understanding of effective and ethical cybersecurity regulations, policies, and best practices to keep your organization’s most critical information secure.

contentful_fields.page_title: Maryville University Post-Baccalaureate Certificate in Cybersecurity Penetration Testing online
contentful_fields.subheading: Gain a comprehensive understanding of effective and ethical cybersecurity regulations, policies, and best practices to keep your organization’s most critical information secure.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The Post-Baccalaureate Certificate in Cybersecurity Penetration Testing program at Maryville University offers hands-on, job-ready skills in one of the fastest-growing areas of cybersecurity. This 100% online program can be completed in just two semesters, preparing students for new career opportunities, further graduate studies, or to sit for the Certified Security Analyst Certification (ECSA) or Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH) certification exams. During the program, you will learn how to:

product_list.header: Assess and respond to risks and threats

title: Master of Science in Cybersecurity
primary_description: Develop the skills to defend organizations from data breaches, strengthen your résumé, and advance your career as a responsible leader in cybersecurity.
secondary_description:
he goal of the Master of Science in Cybersecurity program is to develop cybersecurity professionals who have a strong foundation of technical knowledge in computer security, network security, and information security. Our program builds the knowledge and skills of security professionals to effectively protect the safety of our communities, companies, and the nation.

UNLEASH YOUR POTENTIAL: Counter complex threats, gain hands-on experience, master cutting-edge tools, learn from industry experts, and prepare for industry-recognized CompTIA professional certifications.
BE A PROTECTOR: Join the ranks of cyber warriors and safeguard businesses, organizations, and nations against malicious threats.
DEFEND against cybercrime and ensure a secure digital future through collaboration, communication, and ethical considerations in the field of cybersecurity.
CULTIVATE teamwork skills and effective communication techniques, preparing you to work seamlessly within interdisciplinary teams and effectively convey complex security concepts to diverse stakeholders
DEMAND ON THE RISE: With the increasing number of cybersecurity attacks, the need for skilled professionals has never been greater. In the United States alone, there are over 700,000 open cybersecurity positions waiting to be filled.
THRIVING JOB MARKET: Cybersecurity is growing at more than twice the rate of the overall economy.

The goal of the Master of Science in Cybersecurity program is to help professionals build a strong foundation in cybersecurity, which translates to technical expertise in computer security, network security, and information security. The program equips professionals with practical knowledge and skills, including the ability to:

product_list.description: theories, principles, and best practices related to the evolving global cybersecurity landscape by assessing and reviewing recent strategies.
scholastic mastery needed to develop research topics and projects based on underlying cybersecurity principles learned throughout the program.
data using accepted best practices for the purpose of synthesizing an effective and ethical cybersecurity solution.
appropriate cybersecurity theories and frameworks to stakeholders to evaluate, mitigate, and manage ongoing risks, threats, and vulnerabilities in contexts of uncertainty.

subject: Law

contentful_fields.page_title: American University Master of Legal Studies (MLS) online
contentful_fields.subheading: Earn an online MLS from American University Washington College of Law , and gain the legal skills you need to help your community or organization make informed decisions.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum: Specializations
featured_products.introduction:
The 30-credit online Master of Legal Studies is designed for professionals — who have law-related responsibilities — and who want to increase their legal knowledge and advance their careers. As a learner in the program, you will learn from world-renowned professors, complete self-paced coursework, and gain hands-on experience during an optional in-person immersion. You can also specialize your degree to align with your specific interests.
Specializations include:

product_list.description: Gain a comprehensive understanding of legal concepts, legal procedures, and the overall U.S. legal system.
Develop specialized knowledge needed to gain credibility, further the mission of your organization, and advance your career by implementing effective health care compliance programs.
Cultivate fundamental skills to stay up to date with the rapid growth of technology, and to ensure compliance with the laws surrounding the sharing and accessing of information.
Learn to comply with internet law and data regulations, to protect against data exposure, and to navigate the legal and compliance concepts surrounding big data.
Gain an in-depth understanding of the legislative processes and procedures used in state legislatures and local government agencies.
Learn to make more effective business decisions and ensure compliance with the law.

title: Master of Arts in Teaching
secondary_description: Pepperdine University believes the purpose of higher education is to develop and equip people of value and virtue, who, in turn, create value and virtue in their communities, nations, and the world. That’s why Pepperdine is committed to the highest standards of academic excellence and Christian values. No matter where you come from or how you study with us — on campus or online — you are welcomed to our community of global scholars who boldly seek to GO THERE.

contentful_fields.page_title: Pepperdine University Master of Arts in Teaching (MAT) online
contentful_fields.subheading: Are you ready to inspire the next generation of children? Develop the technical and soft skills to become an effective Pre-K to 12 teacher.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The 30-credit curriculum provides an excellent professional foundation, combining explorations of theory with practical application. Engaging online instruction is paired with hands-on classroom experience that prepares you to apply for licensure while equipping you with the skills and tools needed to become an effective teacher. You will complete six core courses, two specialization-specific courses, and three clinical experience rotations in a classroom — to meet a minimum of 600 California-mandated hours.

product_list.description: Build a strong foundation in essential topics and skills, including instructional design, and literacy theory and methods. You’ll also explore educational topics such as equity and social justice, address contemporary issues in education, and learn effective strategies for teaching multilingual learners, and creating inclusive classroom environments.

Tailor your education to align with your chosen career path. These courses provide you with the teaching methods necessary for success in kindergarten and elementary school classrooms, or in middle school and high school settings.

This three-part classroom sequence offers a full-time opportunity to engage in your assigned classroom and deliver whole-class instruction under the supervision of certified practitioners. These experiences will occur at different school sites and across various grade levels, ensuring a diverse and comprehensive learning experience.

title: Master of Science Strategic Marketing Practice
secondary_description: The world of marketing is constantly evolving and requires professionals who are equipped to think and act strategically and globally in order to keep pace. The University of Birmingham’s online MSc Strategic Marketing Practice combines marketing expertise with leadership and analytical skills to advance your career as an executive, consultant, entrepreneur, or specialist, anywhere in the world.

contentful_fields.page_title: University of Birmingham Master of Science Strategic Marketing Practice online
contentful_fields.subheading: The world of marketing is constantly evolving and requires professionals who are equipped to think and act strategically and globally in order to keep pace. The University of Birmingham’s online MSc Strategic Marketing Practice combines marketing expertise with leadership and analytical skills to advance your career as an executive, consultant, entrepreneur, or specialist, anywhere in the world.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The online MSc Strategic Marketing Practice combines traditional marketing principles, theory, and practise with the latest in digital marketing innovations. Delivered through a global lens, the curriculum emphasises the ethical, social, and sustainability considerations required for marketing professionals to elevate brands. Develop robust marketing skills, and gain tools for a wide range of senior marketing roles through interactive lectures, seminars, global case studies, and more. You will explore key marketing topics that include the following.

product_list.description: Strengthen industry-relevant leadership and managerial competencies through leadership style analysis, reflective activities, group projects, and more.
Gain a comprehensive understanding of international marketing strategies, learn to analyse consumer behaviour in global markets, and explore marketing efforts across different cultures and regions.
Discover the ethical, social, and environmental considerations in marketing practices, along with the ability to evaluate the implications of marketing decisions and act responsibly.
Stay up to date on digital marketing trends, tools, and technologies. Learn to leverage and optimise digital channels and tools to boost performance for brands.

title: Master of Science in Education
primary_description: This comprehensive program equips professionals from all sectors with inclusive leadership expertise and advanced learning theory — preparing them to seek educational leadership positions in public, private, and not-for-profit organizations.
secondary_description:
The online Master of Science in Education from Pepperdine University isn’t just for teachers. This comprehensive program equips professionals from all sectors with inclusive leadership expertise and advanced learning theory — preparing them to seek educational leadership positions in public, private, and not-for-profit organizations.

Note: This program does not prepare teachers for licensure. 

Four concentration options: Choose between Leadership in Learning Design and Technology, Leadership in Pre-K to 12 Education, Leadership in Higher Education, and Organizational Leadership and Learning.

Become an educational leader: Develop seamless, connected, and inclusive learning experiences, and learn how to drive change in your industry through educational initiatives.

Doctoral pathway: Take advantage of our doctoral pathway; upon graduation, some units can apply to your choice of the Graduate School of Education and Psychology’s four doctoral programs. 

About Pepperdine University 

We believe the purpose of higher education is to develop and equip people of value and virtue, who, in turn, create value and virtue in their communities, nations, and the world. That’s why we are committed to the highest standards of academic excellence and Christian values. No matter where our students come from or how they study with us — on campus or online — we welcome them to our community of global scholars who boldly seek to GO THERE.

contentful_fields.page_title: Pepperdine University Master of Science in Education Online
contentful_fields.subheading:
The online Master of Science in Education from Pepperdine University isn’t just for teachers. This comprehensive program equips professionals from all sectors with inclusive leadership expertise and advanced learning theory — preparing them to seek educational leadership positions in public, private, and not-for-profit organizations.

Note: This program does not prepare teachers for licensure.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The online Master of Science in Education has a 30 credit curriculum that takes 15 months to complete part-time. This curriculum is composed of six core courses, three concentration courses, and a final capstone project. You will choose between four concentrations, and have the option to take part in an immersive experience at our Malibu, California campus.

product_list.description: Critical Thinking and Communication (3 credits) Virtual Learning, Collaboration, and Transmedia (3 credits) Ethics, Values, and Inclusion (3 credits) Program Design and Evaluation (3 credits) Applied Analytics and Data Visualization (3 credits) Entrepreneurial Leadership for Innovation and Change (3 credits) Capstone Integration Experience (3 credits)

The online Master of Science in Education offers four concentrations you can choose from to become the best leader you can be in your industry. For each concentration, you will complete three additional courses. The four concentrations are: Concentration in Leadership in Learning Design and Technology (9 credits total) Concentration in Leadership in Higher Education (9 credits total) Concentration in Leadership in Pre-K to 12 Education (9 credits total) Concentration in Organizational Leadership and Learning (9 credits total)

The optional, weekend-long immersion experience takes place on Pepperdine University’s campus in Malibu, California. It serves as a platform for students to engage with peers, faculty, and industry professionals in a collaborative environment . Through community building and engaging sessions, students can deepen their understanding of their field and build meaningful connections.

title: Master of Science in Occupational Therapy
primary_description: With a master’s in Occupational Therapy, you’ll help individuals who are recovering from an illness or an injury to return to activities that are important to them.
secondary_description:
Help people. Work in a variety of settings.

With a master’s in Occupational Therapy, you’ll help individuals who are recovering from an illness or an injury to return to activities that are important to them. Occupational therapists work with people of all ages, from infants to the elderly, in patients’ homes, hospitals, rehabilitation centers, nursing homes, schools, private practice and community agencies.

Russell Sage College’s 80-credit master’s program in Occupational Therapy includes classes, research experiences and field placements centered around the foundations of occupational therapy; therapeutic evaluations and interventions; and professional identity and responsibility. The program prepares students for the certification exam administered by the National Board for Certification in Occupational Therapy (NBCOT), which leads to national certification and eligibility for state licensure as an occupational therapist.

The occupational therapy curriculum emphasizes the person, environment and occupation relationship and incorporates an experiential approach that focuses on students engaging as active learners. Foundation and upper level clinical courses promote an understanding of the dynamic relationship between health, well-being and occupational engagement for a person’s ability to participate in valued life activities and roles. Students are immersed in learning opportunities to both promote clinical reasoning skills and develop a systemic view of health and service delivery systems.

The occupational therapy curriculum emphasizes the person, environment and occupation relationship and incorporates an experiential approach that focuses on students engaging as active learners. Foundation and upper level clinical courses promote an understanding of the dynamic relationship between health, well-being and occupational engagement for a person’s ability to participate in valued life activities and roles. Students are immersed in learning opportunities to both promote clinical reasoning skills and develop a systemic view of health and service delivery systems.

contentful_fields.subheading: Become a driving force in solving pressing conflicts in your community and the world through the advanced Master of Laws in Dispute Resolution degree for lawyers.

featured_products.heading: Program structure
featured_products.introduction: Learners complete 24 units over the course of 12 months or 24 months. Their instructors are the very same faculty members who teach the on-campus program. Both versions of the program focus on the legal, cultural, and psychological factors that can affect complex negotiations and conflict.

product_list.header: Flexibility is at the heart of the program
product_list.description: Besides taking 10 required courses that cover topics such as negotiation theory and practice, psychology in conflict communication, and cross-cultural conflict and dispute resolution, learners get to also pick 14 elective units. The latter allow learners to customize their education based upon their unique career goals.

product_list.header: Electives cover a wide array of topics
product_list.description: These include conflict and systems design for corporations and organizations, divorce and family mediation, and environmental and public policy dispute resolution.

title: Master of Social Work
primary_description: BE THE VOICE OF YOUR COMMUNITY
secondary_description:
As stated by the Council on Social Work Education, the profession of social work promotes human and community well-being. Socials workers focus on social and economic justice at the local, national, and global level. They are often pioneers - challenging the status quo and working tirelessly to help others help themselves. 

Social workers have many options for specialization. Choose what impassions you in areas such as: child or adult protective services, health care, mental health, individual and family counseling, criminal justice, or social agency administration. 

Career opportunities include health care services, schools and universities, youth development, senior services, adoptions and foster care, community development, child and family services, mental health services, government and not-for-profit organizations. 

As a social worker, you will be the voice of your community that promotes well-being as well as social and economic justice at the local, national, and global level. Learn from veteran practitioners and community leaders provide you with the knowledge and skills needed for advanced practice and leadership, and help you obtain first-hand social work experience. Within a couple years, or within one year in the Advanced Standing Program, you will become the help individuals, families, and communities need to lead a better life.

contentful_fields.page_title: Hawai‘i Pacific University Master of Social Work online
contentful_fields.subheading: This online Master of Social Work (MSW) program helps you to develop a multicultural social work practice, advocate for social and economic justice, and assist in healing communities affected by intergenerational consequences of historical and cultural trauma.

featured_products.heading: A curriculum that interweaves Indigenous perspectives
featured_products.introduction: The online MSW curriculum combines core courses, two focus area options, an in-person cultural immersion, and direct clinical experiences. You will learn to promote community wellbeing through classes that focus on individuals, families, various social service programs, evidence-based practices, and human-service policies. Guided by Hawai‘ian values, you will develop cultural competence, and learn how to practice cultural humility through actively listening, engagement with, and service to diverse populations in multicultural settings. The online MSW program offers two focus areas to help you grow into the social work leader you want to be:

product_list.description: This focus builds on foundation year courses to further promote social work practice through a decolonial, Indigenous lens — meaning, you will begin a process of decolonizing your thinking and move toward understanding social work practice from an interwoven approach that incorporates both Indigenous and Western worldviews.

This focus allows you to learn the nuances of social work practice within local, state, and federal government programs when engaging, assessing, and treating active-duty military, veterans, and military family members. Courses center on social issues and cultural contexts that are prevalent in these groups, such as homelessness, substance abuse, deployment stressors, and military sexual trauma.

Paulson School of Engineering and Applied Sciences (SEAS), and the Faculty of Arts and Sciences (FAS).

contentful_fields.page_title: Harvard University Business Analytics Program (HBAP) Online
contentful_fields.subheading: Leverage analytics and Artificial Intelligence to make strategic decisions and lead cross-functional teams in a data-centric business landscape.

featured_products.heading: Case-based curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The HBAP curriculum is based on the case method, which is a critical aspect of the Harvard Business School experience. The program is frequently updated to match industry changes and new tech, ensuring learners stay equipped for the evolving world of data analytics. During the program — which covers more than 65 case studies that speak to a variety of real-world business challenges — you will take:

product_list.description: Learn how to speak the language of data scientists with courses in  quantitative analysis, supply chain management, Artificial Intelligence, programming, machine learning, and more.
Network with Harvard faculty and collaborate with your classmates during in-person immersions, which are held at the Harvard Business School campus in Boston.
Sharpen your leadership and management skills during two intensive, online, two-week seminars: Leadership, Innovation, and Change and Leadership; and People Analytics.

The Master of Science in ABA program utilizes an evidence-based, data-driven perspective for understanding behavioral psychology. Learners explore principles and techniques of applied behavior analysis through assessing behavior patterns, selecting strategies to promote change, and determining target behaviors for clients diagnosed with impairments such as traumatic brain injury, developmental disabilities, or autism.

Below are two of the program’s featured courses:

product_list.header: Multiculturalism and Diversity in Applied Behavior Analysis
product_list.description: Delve into discovering how socioeconomic backgrounds, gender, belief systems, ethnicity, and race affect working with diverse populations.
Collaborate with providers, determine assessments, interpret data while identifying client difficulties, and convey concepts in nontechnical language.

title: Master of Science Sustainable Development in Practice
primary_description: Sustainable development graduates are equipped to tackle the strategic challenges being faced by companies, individuals and governments, and implement the changes required to protect our planet.
secondary_description:
Our MSc provides you with the knowledge to help organisations move towards a greener future. It examines the societal transformations required to tackle the climate emergency, protect the environment, and shift towards sustainable consumption and production – as outlined by the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals.

This course is run by our Centre for Environment and Sustainability (CES), an interdisciplinary hub for forward-thinking environmental and sustainability-related research and postgraduate teaching.

We’ll provide insight into the latest thinking in numerous important areas, covering the essentials needed to analyse the relationship between environmental issues and human society. As part of this approach, you’ll evaluate political, socio-economic, ethical, cultural and regulatory frameworks, and acquire an understanding of the theory and application of sustainable development, while developing a sensitive appreciation of the issues surrounding it.

On this course you will hear from external speakers from industry, government and non-governmental organisations who are active in establishing sustainable development. It also provides a route to the Institute of Environmental Management and Assessment graduate membership.

contentful_fields.page_title: University of Surrey MSc Sustainable Development in Practice online
contentful_fields.subheading: The University of Surrey’s online MSc Sustainable Development in Practice course aligns with the United Nations 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development and will prepare you to implement systems-wide policies and solutions across sectors.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The online MSc Sustainable Development in Practice provides a global overview on today’s existential challenge: the need to build a new social, economic, and institutional system that guarantees long-term wellbeing for all. This course is for you if you’re hungry to find practical solutions to sustainability challenges now, not 30 years from now. By the end of the course, you will:

product_list.description: Understand the basic principles of sustainable development, its policy implications, and applicable solutions.
Develop technical knowledge to be applied to real-life situations.
Acquire necessary skills to discuss and debate sustainable development solutions from a multisectoral and multicultural perspective.
Gain a global understanding of the cultural, social, and implementation particularities of sustainable development solutions.

introduction.value: The Post-Baccalaureate Certificate in Data Analytics from Maryville University prepares students to build robust data programs to inform strategic, actionable solutions in today’s businesses. The 100% online, four-course program teaches foundational programming skills that utilize top data analytics tools including Excel, Python, R, SQL, and Power BI. A mix of hands-on projects and project-based learning ensures you emerge with an impressive portfolio of work that reflects the responsibilities you will face on the job, or to position you to pursue a master’s degree.

title: Master of Education in Educational Leadership
primary_description: Activate transformative change in classrooms, schools, and higher education institutions as a reflective and socially responsible leader.
secondary_description:
Hawaiian-inspired values: Become a more reflective and socially responsible educator by embracing the native Hawaiian values of Pono, Kuleana, and Aloha. 
Project-based M.Ed.: Practice using new technologies and instructional strategies during  hands-on projects.
Two concentration options: Grow into the leader you want to be by choosing a concentration in educational leadership or instructional design.
The 33-credit curriculum combines 11 courses, two concentration options, several hands-on projects, and a capstone research project. You’ll become a more informed and socially responsible educator by studying current issues and trends in educational leadership such as diversity, social change, technology, budgeting, and legal issues. After you graduate, you’ll have a firm grip on how to use instructional strategies and the latest technology tools to deliver inclusive, transformative learning experiences.

contentful_fields.page_title: Hawai‘i Pacific University Master of Education in Educational Leadership online
contentful_fields.subheading: Activate transformative change in classrooms, schools, and higher education institutions as a reflective and socially responsible leader.

featured_products.heading: A self-reflective, leadership-focused curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The 33-credit curriculum combines 11 courses, two concentration options, several hands-on projects, and a capstone research project. You’ll become a more informed and socially responsible educator by studying current issues and trends in educational leadership such as diversity, social change, technology, budgeting, and legal issues. After you graduate, you’ll have a firm grip on how to use instructional strategies and the latest technology tools to deliver inclusive, transformative learning experiences. As an online graduate student in the program, you will learn to: Use assessment strategies to evaluate and ensure the continuous intellectual, social, and physical development of the learner. Understand diversity and provide equal learning opportunities to create a learning environment that encourages positive social interaction, active engagement, and self-motivation. Research, evaluate, and use a variety of instructional strategies to encourage their students' development in critical thinking, problem-solving, and performance skills. Use effective communication to foster active inquiry, collaboration, and supportive interaction in the classroom. Become reflective practitioners who continually evaluate the effects of their choices and actions on others, and who actively seek out opportunities to grow professionally. The online M.Ed. in Educational Leadership offers the following two concentrations to help you grow into the leader you want to be:

product_list.description: This concentration addresses instructional design, theory and practice of e-learning, and multimedia strategies for instructional media. You’ll be prepared to become a leader in training, development, and innovative teaching.
This concentration explores educational assessment, teacher leadership, budget analysis and planning, and educational law. You’ll be prepared to become a leader in administration and policy.

title: Ed.D. in Organizational Learning and Leadership
partner: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
primary_description: Empowering working professionals with knowledge, skills, and experiences to create positive change through a human-centered approach to leadership.
secondary_description:
The curriculum comprises 17 courses totaling 54 credits, and includes a capstone project where students delve into a pertinent organizational challenge. Purposefully designed, the program provides students with the tools to empower individuals within their community, enabling them to help their organization achieve its goals and mission. 

During your graduate journey, you will learn to:

Apply diverse strategies for effective organizational learning and change.
Foster an inclusive culture, empowering diverse voices for improvement.
Manage organizations within complex systems, attending to context and stakeholders.
Assess structure, resources, and power dynamics for positive systemic change.
Use data to evaluate organizational learning, making ethical choices for advancement.

In the spring semester, the Ed.D. in Organizational Learning and Leadership offers an optional in-person immersion on the iconic University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill campus. This immersion aims to enhance traditional learning by fostering community, connecting students with faculty, and providing exploration opportunities. 

The immersion builds a supportive learner community through team-building, discussions, and campus events. Students interact with faculty, explore program opportunities, and connect with leaders in organizational learning and leadership, enriching their academic and professional journeys.

product_list.description: The curriculum consists of 17 courses, including a capstone project designed to showcase your ability to solve an organizational challenge relevant to your context.
Collaborate closely with fellow students on class assignments to create strong peer connections and expand your professional network.
Develop dynamic leadership practices — guided by values of responsible talent development, collaboration, and inclusivity — to help any organization achieve its goals and mission.
The program is designed by expert faculty who are passionate about helping their students achieve professional success at the highest levels, both in the public and private sectors.

title: Master of Science Psychology
primary_description: Learn from lecturers who are active researchers in key psychological areas such as behavioural, cognitive, developmental, personality and social psychology
secondary_description:
We’ll evolve your knowledge of the theories and practical applications of contemporary psychology, with emphasis on how psychology is applied in practice. You'll learn about the core areas of psychology, including cognitive, developmental and social psychology, the biological bases of psychology and individual differences. You’ll explore the brain, behaviour, personality and psychopathology, building an understanding of the conceptual and historical issues in psychology.

You'll develop the research and statistical skills needed to conduct independent research projects under our expert supervision. You’ll also complete a research dissertation that will allow you to carry out experiments and start or join existing projects on important topics in the field. We’ll match your interests with the expertise of our academic staff, ensuring you get the best support possible. These collaborations have seen previous students’ work being published in top-tier journals.

contentful_fields.page_title: University of Surrey MSc Psychology online
contentful_fields.subheading: Develop a set of highly transferable skills in statistics, applied research methods and a broad range of psychology topics.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: This online MSc Psychology course will provide you with a foundation in statistics, applied research methods and all the central areas of contemporary psychology: developmental, personality, social, cognitive, biological and environmental. The curriculum is pending accreditation with the British Psychological Society (BPS). Throughout the course you will build the theoretical and qualitative/quantitative methodological expertise to conduct psychological research within or outside of the formal field of psychology. Throughout the course, you will learn how to:

product_list.description: Apply psychological theories and research to critically analyze behavior and preferences in a variety of psychological sub-disciplines.
Learn how to use basic and advanced research design, and quantitative and qualitative analysis methods.
Explain how psychology contributes to societal issues, such as sustainability

title: Master of Arts in Psychology
secondary_description: Pepperdine University offers its Master of Arts in Psychology program online, enabling students across the country to receive a Pepperdine graduate education without attending classes on campus. The online master’s in psychology program provides a comprehensive overview of psychology and allows students to develop the skills needed to assess personality and intelligence and treat mental and emotional disorders.
subject: Social Sciences

contentful_fields.page_title: Pepperdine University Master’s in Psychology online
contentful_fields.subheading: Earn a master’s in psychology rooted in purpose, service, and leadership. Prepare to pursue doctoral study or support organizations in the human-services field.

featured_products.heading: Featured courses
featured_products.introduction: The program features a robust course list that empowers learners to explore human behavior. Courses cover the fundamental principles of the psychology field and various psychotherapy techniques from a non-clinical lens. As a student, you’ll complete five foundation courses, nine core courses, and two electives. Sample courses include:

product_list.description: Examine the major theoretical approaches to the practice of counseling and psychotherapy; explore key assumptions of various applied theories; and learn about strategies for effecting change.
Examine the prevalence, risk factors, effects, and recovery processes for multiple traumatic experiences; explore the cultural context of trauma recovery; and learn about evidence-based treatments.

Gain an understanding of clinical and empirical advances in positive psychology; evaluate the societal myths within this genre; and examine how these principles play out in the real world on a global scale.

title: Master of Science-Business in Data, Insights, and Analytics
primary_description: Learn to communicate data insights to top executives in your organization — and use those insights to power future-forward business solutions.
secondary_description:
Stand out as a dynamic leader in business analytics, with a graduate degree in business from the University of Wisconsin–Madison. Learn to communicate data insights to top executives in your organization — and use those insights to power future-forward business solutions.

The world-renowned Wisconsin School of Business at the University of Wisconsin–Madison helps future-focused business leaders build a healthier, more sustainable, and more equitable world. Founded in 1900, the Wisconsin School of Business was one of the first five business schools in the nation, and has been trusted to lead for more than 100 years. It continues this tradition of excellence and innovation today with an online Master of Science-Business in Data, Insights, and Analytics available to all, regardless of their location. 

The Wisconsin School of Business designed the Master of Science-Business in Data, Insights, and Analytics program to set learners on a path for continued professional growth. 

Delivered by expert faculty, the 15-course curriculum invites learners to meet business challenges with innovation. Discover a flexible, affordable program built to enhance your data analytic skills and leadership prowess. 

As a learner in the program, you will:
Engage in a fully asynchronous curriculum designed to offer you the flexibility you need to balance studies with a busy career and personal life.
Master essential data analytic tools, including Python, R, SQL, Tableau, AWS, and Snowflake.
Learn a range of relevant topics such as machine learning, data visualization, and cloud computing.

title: Master of Science International Business Management
primary_description: Make sure you have the skills and knowledge that employers look out for, and you’ll have the chance to engage with real, contemporary challenges within modern business throughout your studies.
secondary_description:
This International Business Management masters course will teach you how to manage a multinational business. You’ll learn how to develop and implement global strategies, and how to make companies of any size truly international. While benefiting from Surrey Business School’s emphasis on enterprise and innovation, you’ll be encouraged and motivated to expand your creative and practical thinking abilities.

Studying this course will help you to gain a thorough understanding of how successful businesses continue to have an international reach, despite the many challenges posed by the modern world.

Our MSc in International Business Management has been designed to help you gain a thorough understanding of how successful businesses maintain an international reach despite challenges posed by the modern world. You’ll learn how to manage a multinational business, develop and implement global strategies, and adopt the techniques required to control multinational business environments. All key skills that employers will be looking for.

We’ll teach you how to effectively formulate and implement global strategies to succeed in international business. We’ll spark your interest by teaching you about the techniques and knowledge that professional managers need to control multinational business environments. You can also expect to explore areas such as the management of responsibility and ethical considerations.

You’ll experience an inspiring combination of our research findings and case studies from international firms and, in the process, discover why adopting some of the best, forward-thinking management techniques from around the world is crucial to success.

contentful_fields.page_title: University of Surrey MSc International Business Management online
contentful_fields.subheading: Prepare to lead organizations into the dynamic and multicultural world of international business.

featured_products.heading: An implementation-focused, international business curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The online MSc International Business Management consists of 180 credits, and is divided into 10 fully autonomous credit-bearing modules. Each module is worth 15 credits, except the final business project, which is worth 30 credits. You will learn how to develop and implement global strategies, consider ethics in business operations, and adopt forward-thinking management techniques to guide multinational businesses towards long-term success. Featured modules include:

product_list.description: Examine how inner and outer organizational factors affect the implementation of a global strategy. Explore the process of global strategy implementation and the factors that influence it.
Explore the similarities and differences in how international and domestic companies manage and engage in business.

Understand digital business activities and their implications in business innovation and competition. Explore a variety of topics and strategies such as digital business technologies, digital business models, digital platforms, and digital marketing to help businesses thrive in the digital age.

Study theoretical frameworks to analyze and understand the power of marketing in national and international contexts. Use theory and case studies from the UK and across the globe to analyze environmental conditions, market competition, consumer behavior, marketing strategy and planning, and the growing influence of technology.

title: Master of Science Artificial Intelligence
primary_description: This one-year full-time MSc will teach you about fundamental AI concepts and the universal machine learning tools essential for any AI job role.
secondary_description:
This one-year full-time MSc will teach you about fundamental AI concepts and the universal machine learning tools essential for any AI job role, as well as specific practical and research skills in key AI topics and applications. You’ll gain experience with cutting-edge tools such as deep neural networks (DNN), recurrent neural networks (RNN) and deep reinforcement learning (deep RL) through regular hands-on exercises and practical labs.

Our Artificial Intelligence MSc stands apart as the sole programme of its kind in the UK. It is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of artificial intelligence (AI) by incorporating a wide range of core topics. On this programme, you will study:

Technical subjects, such as computer vision, natural language processing and audio analysis, to develop strong technical expertise
Application-specific areas, such as health and the metaverse, to ensure you develop specialised knowledge in emerging AI fields
Regulatory and legal aspects of AI, to equip you with a critical understanding of the ethical and legal considerations that will shape the future of AI.
The growth of AI is rapidly changing the way we live, work and learn. However, there’s a real shortage of AI talent worldwide, both to serve the industry and to drive future research.

This course will enable you to capitalise on the wide spectrum of career opportunities provided by AI, preparing you to work in industry, take an entrepreneurial route or pursue further research.

The course consists of technical modules delivered by our School of Computer Science and Electronic Engineering, along with the opportunity to take related modules in business or law and ethics. You’ll also undertake a year-long project on an AI topic that interests you. You’ll be supervised throughout the project by an academic specialising in your chosen subject area.

contentful_fields.page_title: University of Surrey MSc People-Centred Artificial Intelligence online
contentful_fields.subheading: Learn the fundamental concepts and tools essential to any AI job role, for the benefit of humans and society.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The MSc People-Centred Artificial Intelligence course consists of 180 credits and is divided into 11 fully autonomous credit-bearing modules. Its cross-discipline approach builds on a strong technical foundation, placing people at the center of all innovation. You will learn fundamental AI concepts and master universal machine learning tools essential for any AI job role, as well as specific practical and research skills in key AI topics and applications. By the end of the course, you will have:

product_list.description: Study subjects such as machine learning, computer vision, and pattern recognition. You will gain in-depth knowledge and experience with cutting-edge tools such as deep neural networks (DNN), transformers, diffusion models, and deep reinforcement learning (deep RL).

Explore emerging AI fields such as health, sustainability, and the Metaverse. You can leverage the cross-disciplinary research to use AI to solve challenges in industries finance, healthcare, manufacturing, or entertainment.

Gain a critical understanding of the societal, ethical, and legislative aspects that will shape the future of AI. Channel your tech expertise to use policy or innovation to implement tech for the betterment of people and society.

secondary_description.value:
This one-year full-time MSc will teach you about fundamental AI concepts and the universal machine learning tools essential for any AI job role, as well as specific practical and research skills in key AI topics and applications. You’ll gain experience with cutting-edge tools such as deep neural networks (DNN), recurrent neural networks (RNN) and deep reinforcement learning (deep RL) through regular hands-on exercises and practical labs.

Our Artificial Intelligence MSc stands apart as the sole programme of its kind in the UK. It is designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of artificial intelligence (AI) by incorporating a wide range of core topics. On this programme, you will study:

Technical subjects, such as computer vision, natural language processing and audio analysis, to develop strong technical expertise
Application-specific areas, such as health and the metaverse, to ensure you develop specialised knowledge in emerging AI fields
Regulatory and legal aspects of AI, to equip you with a critical understanding of the ethical and legal considerations that will shape the future of AI.
The growth of AI is rapidly changing the way we live, work and learn. However, there’s a real shortage of AI talent worldwide, both to serve the industry and to drive future research.

This course will enable you to capitalise on the wide spectrum of career opportunities provided by AI, preparing you to work in industry, take an entrepreneurial route or pursue further research.

The course consists of technical modules delivered by our School of Computer Science and Electronic Engineering, along with the opportunity to take related modules in business or law and ethics. You’ll also undertake a year-long project on an AI topic that interests you. You’ll be supervised throughout the project by an academic specialising in your chosen subject area.

page_title.value: University of Surrey MSc People-Centred Artificial Intelligence online

subheading.value: Learn the fundamental concepts and tools essential to any AI job role, for the benefit of humans and society.

introduction.value: The MSc People-Centred Artificial Intelligence course consists of 180 credits and is divided into 11 fully autonomous credit-bearing modules. Its cross-discipline approach builds on a strong technical foundation, placing people at the center of all innovation. You will learn fundamental AI concepts and master universal machine learning tools essential for any AI job role, as well as specific practical and research skills in key AI topics and applications. By the end of the course, you will have:

description.value: Study subjects such as machine learning, computer vision, and pattern recognition. You will gain in-depth knowledge and experience with cutting-edge tools such as deep neural networks (DNN), transformers, diffusion models, and deep reinforcement learning (deep RL).

Explore emerging AI fields such as health, sustainability, and the Metaverse. You can leverage the cross-disciplinary research to use AI to solve challenges in industries finance, healthcare, manufacturing, or entertainment.

Gain a critical understanding of the societal, ethical, and legislative aspects that will shape the future of AI. Channel your tech expertise to use policy or innovation to implement tech for the betterment of people and society.

title: University of Sydney’s Master of Cybersecurity
secondary_description: The University of Sydney’s Master of Cybersecurity (Online) is designed for experienced tech or STEM professionals who want to discover emerging technologies in cybersecurity. Students will learn to lead cybersecurity initiatives at the organisational level and stay at the forefront of evolving privacy and security regulations.

title: Certificate in Child Life Specialist
secondary_description:
During the program, you will learn how to: 

Support young patients and their families: Provide care and stability in the treatment room and beyond, serving as an advocate to help patients and their families navigate a complex healthcare environment. 

Provide a safe environment: Create safe settings for children as they acclimate to a new healthcare environment, developing age-appropriate play and learning activities to complement early learning within a therapeutic setting. 

Build trusted relationships: Establish relationships with children, parents, and medical staff to authentically communicate concerns and questions to achieve the best solution for the patient.

Develop individualized care coordination strategies: Plan and implement tailored strategies for each patient across specialists, social workers, schools, and more.

contentful_fields.page_title: Maryville University Certificate in Child Life Specialist online
contentful_fields.subheading: Learn how to create safe and welcoming environments to minimize trauma for children facing serious medical issues while addressing their needs and advocating for their care.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: Learners enrolled in the child life certificate program will learn how to address children’s unique physical and emotional needs and challenges as young patients and their families face a serious medical diagnosis or hospitalization. The 13-course, 39-credit program also includes a field experience or a practicum that offers students the opportunity to prepare for the CCLS certification exam to become a certified child life specialist. During the program, you will learn how to:

Plan and implement tailored strategies for each patient across specialists, social workers, schools, and more.

Through live online classes, students develop advanced skills without relocating. Able to be completed in 15 months and no GRE currently required. Master's degree preferred, and programming exp. required.
subject: Computer Science

contentful_fields.page_title: Syracuse University M.S. in Cybersecurity online
contentful_fields.subheading: Join the Orange alumni network of 250,000+ professionals, and learn to identify, prevent, and counteract the cybercrimes that threaten your organization’s critical systems and sensitive information.

featured_products.heading: Course spotlight: machine learning
featured_products.introduction: This course examines the relationship between machine learning and computer security and outlines the basics of machine learning theory and its methodologies. In addition to evaluating complex research problems, students learn high-level topics, including:

product_list.description: Discover the algorithms that work as the backbone of machine-learning capabilities.
Explore the functions of neural networks, a subset of machine learning that mimics the cognitive functions of the human brain.
Measure how well a machine can comprehend tasks using mathematical frameworks.
Learn how to protect essential assets and information from unauthorized criminal activity.

title: Master of Science in Supply Chain Management
secondary_description: Since establishing the nation’s first supply chain management program in 1919, the Whitman School of Management has expanded its commitment to the supply chain discipline through the online M.S. in Supply Chain Management. The program focuses on risk management, financial management, and improving efficiencies in distribution and manufacturing while training professionals to modernize inventory management for their organization.
subject: Business & Management

contentful_fields.page_title: Syracuse University Master’s in Supply Chain Management online
contentful_fields.subheading: The online Master’s in Supply Chain Management from the Whitman School of Management prepares you to create more efficient supply chains and improve the product life cycle of organizations.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction:
The 30-credit online curriculum explores topics such as risk management, financial management, and the creation of innovative and digital supply chain strategies. By learning from expert faculty, collaborating with peers on group projects, and applying new skills directly to your current role, you will graduate prepared to use supply chain design and analysis to make meaningful distribution and manufacturing decisions for any organization. 
Core courses include:

product_list.description: Survey the terminology, concepts, problems, and tools that support decision-making across the four major supply chain processes.
Gain hands-on experience in data collection, analysis, and interpretation. Master analytical tools including Microsoft Excel, Google Analytics, and R Programming.
Learn the three main principles that guide corporate managers in maximizing firm value: the investment principle, the financing principle, and the dividend principle.
Study the influence of supply chain management and logistics on corporate strategy and profitability.
Gain an understanding of modeling for managerial decision making. Learn about the formulations, solutions, interpretations and limitations of network models, queuing models, and more.

title: Master of Applied Data Science
partner: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
primary_description: Master the data life cycle and apply data insights to drive organizational and social change.
secondary_description:
Data is the universal language of collaboration. Master the data life cycle and apply data insights to drive organizational and social change. 
The online Master of Applied Data Science curriculum will equip you to thoughtfully leverage every stage of the data life cycle — collecting, curating, interpreting, visualizing, and applying — to identify and tell a story through data. The 30-credit curriculum is composed of 10 courses and includes a culminating capstone project.
UNC-Chapel Hill’s online Master of Applied Data Science program is offered by the School of Data Science and Society, in collaboration with the School of Information and Library Science; Department of Biostatistics at the Gillings School of Global Public Health; and Department of Computer Science, Department of Mathematics, and Department of Statistics and Operations Research at the College of Arts and Sciences.

owners.name: The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill

contentful_fields.subheading: Data is the universal language of collaboration. Master the data life cycle and apply data insights to drive organizational and social change.

featured_products.heading: Curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The online Master of Applied Data Science curriculum will equip you to thoughtfully leverage every stage of the data life cycle — collecting, curating, interpreting, visualizing, and applying — to identify and tell a story through data. The 30-credit curriculum is composed of 10 courses and includes a culminating capstone project.

product_list.description: Build a foundation in data governance and ethics, real-world applications, advanced programming, statistical modeling, big data, databases, and machine learning.
Add to your skills in areas such as deep learning, natural language processing, data visualization and communication, experiment design, and bioinformatics.
Solve real-world data challenges in a team-based practicum. Carolina faculty and staff will leverage their networks to identify projects and organizations.

title: Master of Arts in Clinical Psychology
secondary_description: Pepperdine University offers its esteemed marriage and family therapy (MFT) master’s program online so students across the country can earn a Pepperdine graduate education without attending classes on campus. The online Master of Arts in Clinical Psychology with an Emphasis in Marriage and Family Therapy program offers a rigorous, values-based education that prepares students to work directly with individuals, couples, and families in need. Students are prepared to pursue licensure in California as licensed marriage and family therapists (LMFT) or licensed professional clinical counselors (LPC).
subject: Social Sciences

contentful_fields.page_title: Pepperdine University Master’s in Clinical Psychology online
contentful_fields.subheading: Earn a master’s in clinical psychology rooted in purpose, service, and leadership. Serve your community as a counselor or therapist.

featured_products.heading: Program tracks
featured_products.introduction: In this program, your courses will explore human behavior, the fundamental principles of the psychology field, and various psychotherapy techniques. As a student, you’ll complete five foundation courses, nine core courses, and two electives. Courses include:

product_list.description: This path is for learners that want to help with a broader scope of mental health issues, and provide service to a larger audience, which includes individuals, families, and organizations. This track prepares learners to pursue LPC licensure and requires 280 field hours of working with clients.

product_list.header: Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) Track
product_list.description: This path is for learners who want to help with issues that stem from marriage and family dynamics and parent-child conflicts, and who want to provide service to couples and families. This track prepares learners to pursue LMFT licensure and requires 225 field hours working with clients.

title: Master’s in Information Systems Executive Program
secondary_description: Gain the skills needed for managerial roles in IT and information systems with an online Master of Science in Information Systems from Syracuse University. Offered by the School of Information Studies (iSchool)—The Original Information School—the program prepares you to make data-driven decisions in a variety of organizations. The program can be completed in 21 months and also offers an Executive program that can be completed in just 15 months. No GRE scores are required to apply.
subject: Communication

contentful_fields.page_title: Syracuse University Master of Science in Information Systems for Executives Program online
contentful_fields.subheading: Join the exciting community of information professionals at Syracuse University’s School of Information Studies (iSchool) — and graduate ready to fuel organizational innovation with critical insights derived from data.

featured_products.heading: 30-credit curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The Master of Science in Information Systems for Executives program’s 30-credit curriculum — taught by the same expert faculty as the on-campus program — features a human-centered approach to information systems. Prepare to build on your existing experience and communicate as a tech-driven business leader in the global marketplace. The curriculum is structured as follows:

product_list.description: Learners build the foundational knowledge and skills they need to prepare for advanced courses in information systems analysis, policy management, and more.

All graduate-level iSchool courses are acceptable electives for the MS in Information Systems for Executives program. Learners may also take up to six elective credits from other schools at Syracuse University, and explore "Selected Topics" courses from within the iSchool that reflect the interests of faculty and learners in a particular semester.

To satisfy their MS in Information Systems for Executives program exit requirements, students must complete, among other things, an information systems research capstone course and a fully supervised internship experience.

subject: Engineering

contentful_fields.page_title: Syracuse University’s Master of Science in Computer Engineering Online
contentful_fields.subheading: Meet technological challenges with optimized innovation. Design breakthroughs in computer hardware and software systems, with Syracuse University’s College of Engineering and Computer Science online.

featured_products.heading: Future-forward curriculum
featured_products.introduction: The 30-credit computer engineering curriculum features courses designed to teach learners to implement high-caliber strategies and meet complex computer engineering challenges with modern solutions . Explore new concepts in security and assurance, network systems, object-oriented design, data structures, computer architecture, and advanced programming.

product_list.description: This core course explores advanced computer architecture concepts, including pipelining, simultaneous multithreading, array processing, multiprocessing, and the relationship between computer design and application requirements. Discover how hardware technology continues to evolve and complete case studies of current systems.
